newsitem.title: USA: Home Depot files for $800 mln debt securities.
newsitem.headline: Home Depot files for $800 mln debt securities.

text.p: Home Depot Inc filed Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission for up to $800 million in convertible subordinated notes due 2001.

Net proceeds will be used to refinance outstanding commercial paper, finance a portion of its capital expenditure program, including planned store expansions and renovations, and for general corporate purposes.
The offering will be made through CS First Boston and Incvemed Associates Inc. The underwriters have an over-allotment option for up to $120 million in additional notes.
